title: Nigel Farage claims EU investigation into undeclared gifts from Brexiteer Arron Banks is 'over and dealt with'
text:
The European Parliament investigation into nearly half a million pounds of undeclared gifts to Nigel Farage from Brexiteer Arron Banks is “over and dealt with”, the Brexit Party leader has said.

The parliament’s code of conduct committee had recommended the “harshest penalty” for Mr Farage and in an unusual step called for Olaf, the EU’s anti-fraud agency to investigate.

Mr Farage told the Telegraph that he had made declarations to Antonio Tajani, the European Parliament President at a meeting in Strasbourg, where they had “laughed” at the idea that Olaf could get involved.

Mr Farage failed to declare donations, which allegedly include a chauffeur-driven car, rent and bills on a £4.4m Chelsea...
description: The European Parliament investigation into nearly half a million pounds of undeclared gifts to Nigel Farage from Brexiteer Arron Banks is “over and dealt with”, the Brexit Party leader has said.
